title: You can see a real steep cliff, caves & coves described by Enid Blyton in many of her adventure books.
review_text:
Chidiya Tapu is a misleading name for this place. It is 27 Kms from Port Blair. 

For starters, there is a small biological garden where you won't find a single bird, aka, chidiya !!! 

Having said that, it is a place from where trekking trail of around 1.50 Kms begin (Munda Pahar), natural path created by flowing water during rains, winding up the hills through reasonable dense forest and sea down there far below. The trail ends on top of a cliff where the sea forms a V shape around the cliff. 
The cliff rises from the sea and is perpendicular to it, with a steep drop. Caves can be seen at the point where the cliff rises from sea. 

You could even see a spectacular sunset from this point, but unfortunately you are not allowed to remain there after 5 pm, without getting the forest guards come and search for you. 

There is a separate sunset point nearby and a good view can be had from there. 

All in all, a good place for trekkers and nature lovers. 

Worth visiting. 

:-) More

title: Chidiya tapu - trek to nature

But once you reach the top the view is absolutely stunning. We were lucky to see a double there. It's quite relaxing . It's about 1.5-2 KMS trek but worth it. On your way back you can enjoy the sunset . Must visit if you are at Port Blair. More

If one wants to experience the country side drive, then drive along this route, or else save your time and explore other things in South Andaman. More

title: Awesome sunset
review_text:
Chidiya tapu is the sunset point of Port Blair. The view of the sun setting over the sea is just awesome as the entire Ocean slowly turns red.....One can sit and lose oneself in the beauty of nature. 

Takes about an hour to reach from Port Blair by vehicle. The road condition is not good as it meanders through the tropical forest. 

There is a biodiversity park just before chidiya tapu which one can visit with children. Thereafter one can proceed. 

Chidiya tapu has a scenic beach with seating area. There are trees uprooted in the tsunami which make a great photo point. Swimming is allowed only inside the enclosed area as there are salt water crocodiles in the area. NOT advisable to take chances.... 

One can trek from the beach to Munda pahar. The view from the top is amazing. 

Worth a half day visit if one has the time. 
Advisable to carry some foodstuff as there are very few vendors selling some basic stuff like coconut water. Beach closes at 5 pm. More

title: A beautiful mangrove beach where you could maybe see a crocodile or two and probably sea-snakes too.
review_text:
Chidiyatapu is about 17 Km from Port Blair. The entry fee is Rs 20/- . There are staff (I think from the Forest Department) who politely brief you at the entry point about safety precautions as well as about environmental issues like the use of polythene etc. 

The entry fee is only Rs 20/- (for Indians). 

People who expect a beach to be full of ice cream vendors, balloon sellers, food stalls etc may find it disappointing because there is very little of all this here. 

However those who go expecting a clean and natural mangrove beach would be delighted. Bathing is permitted only within the netted areas due to the danger of crocodile attacks. 

One could go for short treks into the surrounding hillocks and could see small fresh-water rivulets joining the sea. It is said that sea-snakes come here to take a drink at these rivulets (they never ingest salt-water). At any rate we did spot a sea -snake in one of the rivulets. Did not see any crocodiles (disappointingly). 

Do not miss the Chidiya Tapu Zoological Park en route. It's a small mini-zoo but has some species endemic to The Andaman & Nicobar Islands. It also has battery operated vehicles for those who have difficulty in walking. More

One can occasionally spot a lizard or a green snake, but can always hear the birds and insects. Keep a watch for the abundant butterflies which comes in all shapes and colors. The lighthouse, the partially depilated hut, the snaky sea, the height of land and the mountains afar offer plenty of opportunity for photography. 
The biological park is home to a variety of trees and a few caged animals, reptiles and birds. Battery operated cars are available at reasonable cost. It definitely is worth a visit, to feel the difference between a normal zoo and the biological park. 
Since the beach is at a forest reserve, facilities are limited. Food except for tender coconut (occasionally) and kulfi is not available at the beach. Hence carrying own water bottles is advisable. At the sunset point however, a few food stalls offer excellent chai and hot bajji's during evening. 
The forest guest house is the only accomodation in the vicinity, and is often fully booked. The beach has eco-friendly changing rooms, shower and washrooms which is decently maintained. 
So in short, it a beach for relaxing and rejuvenating. More

title: Serene. Overcrowded. Oxymoronic?
review_text:
We headed for Chidiya Tapu, with our elderly parents, from Sinclairs Hotel around 3 .15 pm. It took almost an hour to reach. The scenery's beautiful as you would initially, for quite a time, hug the boisterous blue sea along with some great view points. And then the winding hilly road with some sharp turns and bumps. Take precautions for those who are motion sick. Avoid full stomach. 
On arriving it was a surprise cacophony of sort, with a number of vehicles and a rather large number of noisy visitors. Much like a picnic spot. Walking a few paces, getting the entry tickets, we entered a heavily wooded area with large tall trees, beautiful sit outs carved of large logs. 
And lo!! In front lay the mesmerising sea dazzling in all its hues in the setting sun. We were really ecstatic forgetting about the pain in getting there, the crowd. Remnants of the tsunami with some uprooted trees, create some abstract architectural beauty especially for those photographers searching for a novel foreground. 
Just sitting out the ever changing ambience, the setting sun creates and if possible sometime thereafter for some beautiful twilight shots (though the guards keep on pestering to leave the moment sun sets in). Quite irritating for ones who want to savour the moment for some more time. More

title: Chidiyatapu, an interesting beach
review_text:
The drive from Port Blair town to Chidiyatapu is through scenic landscape . This attracts a lot of visitors and the place is chockful of people and vehicles. Fortunately the beach area is cordoned and out of bounds for vehicles . Visitors need to enter personal details such as name and phone no. in a register before entry and the place is swarming with very officious looking security personnel and also a few policemen. The beach is decent-sized and the shore line is fringed with a lot of tall trees . Like every other beach in Andamans this beach too boasts of crystal clean waters, picturesque looks and brilliant emerald green waters . 

As the name suggests, chidiyatapu ( corrupted version of chidiya top ?? ) is reputed to be a place where birds congregate . We did have high expectations of bird sightings but drew a blank save for a beautiful racquet-tailed drongo high up in the tree and a few cuckoos. The beach is of average sized, clean and free of debris . The security personnel were overzealous in getting bathers and visitors to the evacuate the beach before 5 pm thus not allowing a sunset view . On the whole chidiyatapu came across as an overhyped place. On a scale of 1 to 10 I would rate this at 7. More

title: Nothing much to see

title: Beautiful sunset and even more beautiful ride to reach there
review_text:
Hard to spot a chidiya there but its a beautiful place with a nice scenic beach where you can spend a nice evening with your loved one. 
Sun sets behind a small hill and it gives a good shot for your cameras. 
Better to hire 2 wheeler from port blair to go there, its 45 min drive with some scenic views along the way. 
Must visit.

title: Fishing and Snorkelling
review_text: Awesome.Couldnt catch any fish since left at 1000 hours(for fishing early morning around 0630 or so).For snorkelling the best site (Infinity Scuba the best in the trade).Very best instructors.The best Biryani on board.

title: Excellent Sunset!!
review_text: This place is excellent for sunset views only. The beach is not recommended for swimming as crocodiles were spotted recently. There are no eateries around the beach, and only 1-2 vendors serving bhel puri, etc. The roads are very narrow and often get congested with traffic flowing in from both the directions. Traffic jams is very common during the sunset time.

title: best place for the evenings
review_text: during my visit, this place literally made some magical image in my mind I have never seen a sea between two mountains and from the middle sun sets and the lights make a light on the water of the sea

title: Again an overrated one.
review_text: Only good for people who likes to watch bird. Its not worth the journey. Its a good place if you stay here. Road is hilly in this region. Nearby Mundapahar beach is also not that good.

title: Must Visit Sunset Beach
review_text: Chidiya tapu, a must visit scenic beach to view an amazing sunset (not like other beaches where you can go swimming). It's quite far from Port Blair main market and is recommended to go by a car with a known person or if you know the way properly, as the roads near the beach are quite narrow. The Destination and the journey to Chidiyatapu itself makes it worth visit.

title: Chidiya Tapu
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is a very beautiful place for sight seeing in port blair. and it is also famous as being a nice sunset point also.

title: Don't miss the sunset
review_text:
The place itself is nothing special. A few benches and swings have been installed under the shade of trees in a small area. Just beyond the trees begins the beach which has no attractions to offer. At the far end, there is a pool fed by the sea during the high tides and a small cluster of mangroves. There are also a small wooden bridge and a watchtower. 
The only special thing about this place is the magnificent sunset in the sea. There are places on the road to Chidiya Tapu which also offer equally good views of the sea and sunset. Make sure you do not miss the spectacle.

title: nothing special
review_text: Normal beach nothing special to watch like havlock ross and other the road journey is bumpy and tiring

title: Nice views
review_text:
It's a long travel ( around 1 hour +) from Port Blair. The place has nice closed area defined in beach for swimming because of risks of water animals. 

Views from this place ( specially sunset) are awesome.

title: Beautiful sunset
review_text: This location is amazing and a must-see for sunset lovers. There were surprisingly few visitors at the time we visited which is supposedly the peak season but the calm sea and the perfect sunset make it worth the 30 minute drive from Port Blair.

title: Super place to view sun set
review_text: Beautiful place to see sunset. Plan well to drive to this place before 4.30 as the sun sets in by 5 behind the mountain. Beautiful water and sun makes it even more beautiful.

title: Pristine Beach
review_text: About 30 kms from Port Blair,this is part of Marine National Park. Small but beautiful beach,ideal for swimming. Sunset from here is one in many and treat to eyes and soul.

title: excellent sunset point do see biological reserve park nearby
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is an excellent spot for seeing sunset. Since we had reached late in the evening we could not go for trekking from chidiyatapu. There is also a biological reserve nearby which will be interesting for children. One should come early at this spot to fully enjoy visit to chidiyatapu.

title: Average experience
review_text: There is nothing to do at Chidiya Tapu. Sunset from here is magnificient. This is small beach but if you have already visited North Bay, Elephant or Havelock, you will find it average.

title: Nature-visit!
review_text: While I was in Port Blair, I couldn't find any patch of tropical forests.So Chidiya Tapu is a nice respite from all those weary thoughts ! Even the 45 minutes drive from the capital is luxuriously green ... Many wallpaper clicks all along the way ! I got mine ! It in itself doesn't house any "chidiya"! So un-eponymous of the tapu. But the natural vegetation and the beaches alongside the views on the journey is not the waste of anyone's time !

title: a very average beach
review_text: An average beach, 50 minutes drive form Fortune Hotel. The Sunset was awesome and had some good pictures there.

title: Average
review_text: After having visited several beaches and islands, we landed in Chidiya Tapu on Day 6 - If you have seen North Bay/ Elephant beach/ Jolly Buoy/ Havelock, frankly nothing much to add from here... we went because we wanted to while away half a day in a relaxed manner..

title: Nature at its best
review_text: Nice Place for nature lovers. Excellent picturesque location. Away from the city and crowd. Definite Must visit place.

title: Nice place for sunset
review_text: It's a nice place to be visited for enjoying the sunset, though we didn't see any bird The photos says it all. The beach was crowded so the taxi guy took us to an offbeat place near to it and had one of the best sunsets

title: Birding, Beach, Diving all at one place !!
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is a must visit place if you're staying around Port Blair. Rather one can choose to stay here itself if interested in Birding, Long peaceful beach and Diving. The water here is so clear and blue even a snorkeller can see fish life like never before. SUnset here is another wonderful thing not to be missed.

title: Not that great
review_text:
Having visited beautiful beaches in Havelock and other islands,i did not find this place that great. 

Located a little far from the city

title: Nice trip
review_text: Worth a visit . You can watch a memorable sunset . You can carry some snacks and change of clothes. May get a little crowded during holiday season.

title: Great sunset point
review_text: Good place to visit during your visit stay in Port Blair. Also visit the botanical park before visiting the sunset point.

title: Awesome Place!!!
review_text: I rented a Bike to visit this place and I tell You the ride is really blissful. I even drived through reserve forest for few Kilometers to reach this place whch was totally worth it. the beach is sublime and beautiful The sanctuary was not as good as i expected.

title: not worth the trip
review_text: There was nothing extraordinary we found at the place, visit only if you have time and absolutely nothing else to do.

title: A step close to Mother Nature
review_text: This beach is situated around 20 kms from port Blair and should on itenary who plan to visit Andaman. you will definitely enjoy the journey in order to reach there...You will find crystal clear water on this beach with scenic beauty around it.

title: Come fall in love with the sea
review_text: The sea here is so calm on certain days it feels like a big pond. The picturesque trees and the best sunset. Most of the photographs you see of sunset in the Andamans are from here. Great place to click photographs.

title: Sunset Point at Chidiya Tapu
review_text:
Good place to enjoy a perfect sunset... if it's a bit cloudy, one can get an excellent sunset view... 

Reach early to get a good place to view, as the place gets very crowded around the time of sunset... one can see mangroves as well, albeit at a little distance...

title: Best Beach and Sunset Point
review_text: Chidyatapu is one of the Best Beach and Sunset point of Andaman and Nicobar Island. 45 Min Drive from the City Port Blair. It is 25+ Km away from the city.

title: Very clean and neat
review_text: Far from the city of Port-blair but less crowded and peaceful beach. You can enjoy the beach at its full

title: Not so great place
review_text: I visited this place twice, in 2008 and 2016, but never spotted a bird there, Chidiya .. NO chidiya tapu now, I was not happy with the swimming area as well, a knee deep area is isolated with net and is dedicated for swimmers, I entered there with bare feet to swim, it was horrible I couldn't even walk few feet because of sharp rocks under the waters, few minutes I went around and came out immediately, crocodile infested area, you can not swim outside the net, I felt it was waste of time traveling from Port Blair and waste of money too.

title: Chidiya Tapu
review_text: We can spend a whole day here, we had spent only the evening. You can have bath in the beach, or just sit and relax and enjoy the view. The place has a national park, sunset point and beach to bathe and play. It is about 28 km from port blair, the drive is between the woods, so green all over and pleasant.

title: beautiful sunset
review_text: Be there by 4.30 pm and see the sun go down behind the range of hills across the sea ( back waters). The mangroves and tree trunk formations are very interesting. It is very well maintained. A must-see.

title: Mesmerizing
review_text: The view from this place is sceneric. Well maintained and cleaned. You need to visit this place by at least 4:00 Pm as the sun set is early in Andaman and hence the evening view here is mesmerizing.

title: Experience dense exotic jungle ride
review_text: On way to Chidiya tapu,you need to drive through dense forests,which is indeed a good experience.The view are really beautiful when you reach the beach site.Only thing,you do not have proper restaurants OR washrooms there.Unfortunately ,we could not see the sunset due to clouds.

title: Average place
review_text: Chidiya tapu is an average place to visit.. one may skip if short of time. The place is far from portblair city.. sunset view was good.. also try not to visit on mondays as sanctuary may be closed

title: Beautiful Sunset Place
review_text: You ahud visit here in the evening. We saw Crocodile here. Do take care of kids here. It is gud for sight seeing, but not for swimming. There is no restaurant here. The beach closes at 5PM.

title: Go to watch sunset
review_text: The road to reach Chidiya Tapu was aweosme. Hang out on wooden swing, eat bhel and must watch sunset.

title: Not worth
review_text: This place is not worth to visit riding bike. Just before reaching on beach, a mountain ride you have to cross.. and beach is not comparable to others beach of Andaman. Although sunset is nice, if weather is clear.

title: Super Sunset, Awesome View...
review_text:
This place is about one hour drive from Port. Blair, drive was very adventures as of very dense forest both sides of the road, bit of sea view also... 

Well maintained Beach, Munda Pahar has good sitting arrangements near beach made up from wood, changing room & showers, swings for kids... 

One can still feel the after affects of Tsunami, many broken trees near beach, guarded area for swimming, kids enjoyed as of secured area... 

Sunset was very aerene, as if Sun was going in to the Sea, one of the best Sunset seen, enjoyed thoroughly...

title: Superb sunset point
review_text:
Around 35 kms from port blair. 
Sunset point comes midway. 
Reminiscent of tsunami tragedy throughout the beach. 
Very small beach but evenings are great.

title: amazing views
review_text: this place is great too watch the sunsets and the guarded area to swim is also too good, one can get click beautiful pictures during sunset

title: Peaceful, private, beautiful and serene
review_text: We stayed in Forest Guest house and found it located at the best spot for a peaceful and scenic stay. Opposite to the guest house is sunset point and the view is mesmerising. The location is having clean sea side but the waters are not to be played in due to salt water crocodiles. The forest department has developed a great sanctuary for animals and the same is open to public during day. It has big enclosures for Salt water Crocodiles, Monitor Lizards, and various species of birds. Great Flora and fauna well labelled. The sunset is extremely beautiful here. If you have time then there is a training institute for scuba diving which certifies you too. Munda Pahad beach is just next to the forest guest house. More

title: Breath Taking ! MUST VISIT
review_text:
Amazing. One of the best places I visited. The entire trip is so scenic and amazing that by the time you reach the Place your modd is super charged!! 

And then the place in itself offers such an amazing view and lifts your spirits! Simply AMAZING !

title: Nice beach to see sunset
review_text: This is one of the sand beaches (not many) that tourists flock to see during sunset. This is a totally non-commercial beach with just the view which is amazing.

title: Sunset point of the Andamans
review_text: This place is called the sunset point of the Andamans. Suitable for clicking beautiful snaps during the sunset behind the mountains. Can spend 30 to 60 minutes here walking along the beach and watching the sunset. The route to Chidya Tapu is through the forest range.

title: No birds to see !!!
review_text: Going by the literal meaning of the beach - 'Chidiya Tapu' is going to be disappointing as there are almost no birds to spot there. But the beach is a nice, calm and peaceful place to relax while enjoying the fresh air and cool sea breeze. It's a well maintained and clean beach. Watching the sun set here is a wonderful experience.

title: Paradise of trees
review_text: If you are nature lover then its a must visit place for you. Its a sunset point amidst trees and sea with a chilled and soothing lagoon view.

title: Half day Evening tour...
review_text:
1) Chidaya tapu is around 50-60 km return from PortBlair..... 

2)It is sunset point.... 

3) u should leave from PortBlair around 2.30 pm...as in Portblair, sun disappear at around 5pm.... 

4) Do not give more than 1200 for ac car to and fro journey from PortBlair.... 

5) it is half day tour after 2.30 pm.....

title: Its a good spot
review_text: It is essentially a picnic spot with a sunset view point far from Port Blair. If you could witness the sunset , your visit was worth it , although I couldn't because of the clouds.

title: Good Sunset Point
review_text:
There is nothing great at Chidya Tapu. It is known as a sunset point and we opted to go there just before sunset. We were fortunate enough to see a fabulous sunset and take a lot of fabulous photographs. 
There is not much more to do there.

title: aka sunset point..
review_text: Also called as Sunset point (because of the spectacular sunset) is 25 kms away from Port Blair.The ride to chidiya tapu offers you some beautiful views to stop on the way. we went there hiring a bike. Its a small beach and it closes after 5:30pm. I would recommend all to climb up the munda pahar right there at the beach to have a amazing view and not just spend the whole time at beach. Do that and you will thank me.

title: A beach of different kind
review_text: Here we could see those trees which were broken during the tsunami. They add a different beauty to the place. The beach here is famous for sunset, it looks amazing. One can go for trek also to get a better view.

title: Excellent biological park
review_text: About an hour journey from pott Blair . A very calm place , you got to see nice flora and fauna. Famous for the sunset , however could not experience it due to time constraints.

title: A heavenly place
review_text:
Very clean place with picturesque view. A wooden brigde, tall trees, jhula, etc makes a place very beautiful, and what to tell about the sea which was very clean without any croud. 

Really amazing and must go place.

title: Unforgettable sunset. ..
review_text: We are from calicut kerala and living near the beach. ..fortune to see many sunsets. ..but chidiyatappu sunset is unforgettable. ...

title: Didn't get to see any birds
review_text: This is another great sea beach located near Port Blair about 30 kilometers away. The literally meaning of 'Chidiya Tapu' is 'Island of Birds' but you really don't get to see any birds here now. We enjoyed cool sea breeze and gentle low tide sea waves. Great place to swim in the shallow sea waters near to the sea shore.

title: Amazing drive to the place, worth going
review_text:
We rented a bike during our stay at Andaman. We drive down to Chidya Tapu and what an amazing ride it was. All through dense forest and once we reached there we were mesmerized. It was isolated, with no one around and I enjoyed collecting shells here as well as clicking picture of some cute crabs 
Must visit.

title: Awesome view !
review_text: This beach is one of the best places in Andaman island. Its a quite beach with peaceful surroundings. Try to visit it during weekdays, you will find it less crowded and at its best. A very scenic place a must for shutterbugs. From the beach one can trek to the sunset point escorted by a guide. Its almost an hour trek. The view from the sunset point is breathtakingly beautiful.

title: Amazing Beach and View Points
review_text: Mundar Pahar Beach was amazing with huge hills in the backdrop behind the great sea. It was a mind boggling view. MUST VISIT beach

title: Nice place to hang out
review_text: Forest department has time restrictions for entry into this place. Cool blue sea and safe to play with family!!!

title: Sunset
review_text: Sunset and view of nature is mind blowing dont visit the chidiyaghar it is waste of time rather stay at beach and view sunset

title: Calm place, nice beach
review_text: The name of the place does not match with the number of birds we came across. The safari through the sanctuary was enjoyable. We saw a couple of bird enclosures, a crocodile enclosure, and few other wild animals. The best part of the trip was the time we spent at the small beach.

title: Nice clean and safe place for sun set view
review_text: While going to Ahidiya tapu you will find very beautiful view of thick green trees both side , not so far from South Port Blair. Evening is the best time as it closed at before 5 O clock . With many warning by forest and tourism dept of A&N Govt for not swimming in open sea , they have remarked a place with boundary of net for safe swimming. You can enjoy with your family members there , good arrangement of taking shower after swimming in sea and changing room by forest and tourism . they have a check post and life saving guard and police to manage any problem and to control everything in discipline. We like it very much and recommend if you have evening to spend in Port Blair. More

title: Great time during evening visit
review_text: We visited this sea beach just before the sun set. It was a great site to see the setting sun on this sea beach. Picturesque view of the sun going beneath the sea waters and rays of sun falling on the waters and getting reflected. Post sun set enjoyed the walk along the sea shore.

title: Chidiya Tapu - Port Blair, South Andaman
review_text: Chidiya Tapu has got a nice beach. Water is clear. It's best place to visit sun set. However it is almost 40 minutes drive from Port Blair.

title: Put your trekking boots on
review_text: Highly recommend this to folks who love trekking. Don't throw water bottles and plastics please. Catch the glimpse of ocean filtering through the thick trees. Morning and evening times are the best but hey we were there at noon. So there were very few people. There was a lady police officer on duty, she said the place is safe for the tourists. The only sound you hear is that of birds in the woods.

title: Perfect place for nature lovers
review_text: Beautiful beach and is very well maintained by Government officials. Some area is cordon off for swimming and also information signage placed in all the places. You can see echo friendly wash rooms provided for the tourists.

title: Worth it!
review_text: You need to go all the way down here, almost near the south Andamans coastline, to view a perfect sunset. Vast coast, beautiful tsunami-hit coastal treeline, orange sun dipping in between them - all add up to an awesome experience. Check weather beforehand though.

title: Beautiful calm beach , Green Waters
review_text:
Beautiful place. 
Way to reach itself is through dense forest which make s a good road trip. 
Make sure you dont go on a high tide day

title: Capture your sunset pics here
review_text: This place is romantic and a delight to capture the sunset. Although bit far away from center but once you reach there, you counter scenic beauty and the whole path to tapu surrounded by dark forests which is amazing experience.

title: amazing
review_text: very nicely made place for tourist but pl take water along with you and some light snacks u only get kulfi and some bhel very nice and clean place and for photo lovers lot of place to take . the best i liked is the seating arrangements . they have toilets and changing room facility.

title: Lovely place
review_text: Southermost point of andaman island. There is munda pahar beach also. Silent serene place to hangout and enjoy sunset. 30 kms from port blair bazaar. Worth going. Book a cab or ride down.

title: Chidiya Tapu - A Perfect spot for Sunset
review_text:
Very peaceful drive for 40 min from the city - 

Way to CT - Completely a scenic beauty with Lusty green forest covering all the way 

And when you reached a Beautiful beach is there for relaxation. And some ancient trees... 

If you expecting bird - come in season time - you can find different species of bird and you can opt for trekking also if have time 

Lost yourself in the sunset in the Evening....:-)

title: Total Disappointment
review_text: Chosen this place over a days visit to Havelock. But was a wrong decision as there's nothing to see except a hike which you can go for. Didn't even saw a single bird over there.

title: Excellant Sunset view
review_text: We visited Chidiya tapu this April with my family ...excellent beach with amazing view of sunset..got some of the best sunset pictures to my collection

title: Worth visiting during sunset, beware of crocodiles
review_text:
Take your own taxi as no public vehicles run in the route. The gates close at 5.30pm so try to start early as the road runs through a desolated stretch of hill forest. 
The beach is frequented by crocodiles as mentioned on warning boards around the place. Its more known as Munda Pahar beach than Chidiyatapu. No such changing rooms found. Also it is not advisable to take baths as the beach is crocodile's den and rocky. Best thing to enjoy is the sunset. One can plan a fishing trip to the Rutland island nearby (mostly done by foreigners). Cars are allowed till the parking lot in front of Munda Pahar beach and then you need to walk down to the waters on foot. Lots of wooden sit outs available along the shore to enjoy and relax. Also there is a thin waterlane which meets the sea at Munda Pahar. Its worth visiting once. However, no such rare birds seen. More

title: Excellent Beach amidst forests
review_text: Excellent beach along the dense forest. A good place for nature lovers and Nature Explorers. Also a birding site.

title: Excellent Sea View
review_text:
This place earlier was famous for different kinds of birds one could spot. Now the excursion in the forests has been banned, after a few mishaps (according to our driver). Nevertheless, the place is beautiful, thou a little commercial. 

On entrance, you see a nice beach. At the end of this beach, there is a small hillock. You can climb it to reach the other side of it, which has a more beautiful, rocky beach..with a lot of crabs on them :) 
The waves breaking on these rocks creates a lovely sprinkle in the air..makes one forget the time. 

That reminds me.. if you visit, make sure you are out by 5 o'clock in the evening. That's when they close the gates. 

P.S. Time of visit - Jan 2015 More

title: Awesome beach and Mesmerizing Sunset
review_text:
Chidiya Tapu is located around 25 kms from Port Blair. 
It is one of the best place to view the sunset in the Andamans. 

Chidiya Tapu mean 'Birds Island' but unfortunately we could not find any birds there. The main attraction is the sea beach, trees and seeing the setting sun. 
This place is definitely an ideal place for enjoying the sea waters and witnessing the serene beauty of Mother nature.

title: Awesome place to go for scuba diving and enjoy the beach
review_text: I came to know about scuba diving facility being available in Chidiya Tapu and came here with my wife. Excellent memories of scuba diving, swimming and enjoying vibrant colors of water.

title: Magnificent views of natural resources and beautiful scenery.
review_text: Just fabulous time spent here. Must visit place. One of the best script writing place cidiya tapu. Best visiting hours at evening sunset time. Fantastic click time there who loves photography

title: Amazing Munda Pahar Beach
review_text: It was thrill to visit Munda Pahar Beach at Chidiya Tapu in South Andaman. To enter this area took a car drive through the lush green deep forest. It is 17 km away from Port Blair. There are many old and tall trees inside this beach area. Beautiful mountain view works as a backdrop to the entire beach. An evening here can be a lifetime sweet memorable experience.

title: Chirya Tapu without birds
review_text: Chiriya Tapu means Island of the Birds, but it is difficult to find even one. However, it is said that prior to the Sunami that had created havoc in the Andamans, there were in deed birds aplenty. It is a pity that they all have now vanished. Still, this place can be visited for its woods and the beach. And, it also has a wonderful vintage point from where you can see the sun setting behind the hills and the trees.

title: Peace meet Beauty.
review_text:
A place where "Peace meets Beauty" . 

Attractive rooted trees white sand blue water what more to get lost into the beauty mother nature has to offer. Be there Experience Chidiya Tapu.

title: Amazing Chidiyatapu
review_text: Chidiyatapu is the best place for the peoples visiting Andaman Island. This place is famous for its sandy beaches and the 'Sunset Point'. There is an another famous spot here known as 'Munda Pahad Beach'. All the benches here are made up of old trees. You can also enjoy trekking here. Very nice place for the family and friends.

title: A serene beach
review_text: a beach which is a little far from the main island. but u can reach their by a car. it is situated on a hilly area. their are trees, lot of greenery, water, mangroves, crabs, sea shells, bhel (snack), wash rooms. Not very high class or for beach activities. Ideal for being in water and enjoying nature.

title: Good for kids,beach activities ,sunset...etc
review_text: It is good spot, 26 km from portblair road transport access .. so many films taken in this spot .. so many types of trees turned into benches with the tree derails .. kids enjoys this spot good .. bathing in beach taking rest enjoy the forest .. just 10 minutes walking into the forest u may enjoy the other side beach.. light house .. suicide point also near by . Scuba diving ,snorkeling coral watching can also done .. It is very famous spot .. don't miss this ..

title: Peaceful and beautiful.
review_text:
This is a very serene place. If you go to Munda Pahar beach, its simply awesome. Just look at natures art using trees. 
Even the govt has used trees for all the benches and tables. 
Very nice place to go. 
Specially to look for Sun Set.

title: Famous for sunset.
review_text: One can go there if not short on time. Otherwise it's ok, go see the sunset on radhanagar beach! The place is not very well managed.

title: Nice Get Away from Port Blair
review_text: It was a cloudy day and so we couldn't see the famous sunset. The beach seemed popular, but after the beaches of Havelock Island, this didn't appeal to us. Overall, it was a nice get away from Port Blair as there isn't much to do in Port Blair. The drive through the villages, forest and to Chidiya Tapu was nice. The site itself is good to visit, but you wouldn't miss anything if you didn't go!

title: serene and calm
review_text:
the ride to start with from port blair city to this far point is aproximately of about 45 mins 
but the drive is worth it for a lot of scenic pics and calm reality of life. 

i rented a two wheeler bike in the city and rode on... in between there is secial reserve forest area which is exotic... u can feel the lush green gigantic trees on either side of the road n u a loner in between. 
but the fragnance of forests wood and mud and fresh leaves gives a spirit lifting feeling. 
while chidiya tapu is best to see at sunset on a clear day it also has the most clear and wonderful waters in port blair for a scuba dive. 
pack ur bottle of water and snacks and go on... u will love it 
a word of caution.... narrow roads and too many bends ....so ride safely. More

title: Amazing place for sightseeing lovers and birdwatching
review_text:
Chidyatapu beach is very ideal place for sightseeing and bird watching.we can reach chidyatapu beach through forest and small hills.Chidyatapu is 28km from Port blair one has visit this place to refresh and for doing swimming .Most of the travelers visit this place at evening hours and spend their leisure time ,this place is filled by natural wealth and white silver sand.In chidiyatapu you can also visit biological park ,where you can see 
various precious tree and wildlife creatures .this park comes under wildlife division of forest.

title: Chidiya Tapu - an relaxing place
review_text: The beach at Chidiya Tapu beach is really nice, one can enjoy the beach water as the waves are not so strong. The place is visited by people for viewing the sunset. Lot of seating arrangement is there where one can sit and enjoy the natural surroundings.

title: “An excellent beach for sunset lovers”
review_text: Its about an hr drive away from Port Blair...Go for sunset view, relaxing and pictures. The access road is in good condition and passes through trees and forest. A wonderful place to see the sunset. The place is opened till sunset and one has to hurry up to leave as soon as the sun sets. As per the locals a good point to watch birds if reached early morning.

title: Mesmerizing sunset view & place to swim !
review_text: A place you can visit after 5pm if you like to see sunset view & wants to try hand in photography. There is an allocated area for swimming as well. Try the different varieties of coconuts which are sold near the entrance. Bet, you alone can't finish one :) A place you can plan for an hour or two..Its 30-45mins far from Portblair.

title: Would have liked to spend more time here
review_text: We did a day trip to Chidiya Tapu and enjoyed it a lot but as we were there in the middle of the day it was very hot. The beach is done very nicely with changing rooms, showers and shade huts but if the tide is out, there is not enough water in the "safe swimming area" to actually swim, and the shallow water also got incredibly hot. There is some snorkelling in the nay but may be difficult to find unless you know where and you'd have to be happy about swimming out into the middle of the bay...there are lots of crocodile shaped logs in the water and the vis was not so good, so we probably did not go far out enough for the better stuff. Also beware sunburn! There is also the small zoo, which seems to be in the process of expanding...the map at the front gate is quite misleading. We spent some time looking for the butterfly house and reptile house before realising they hadn't been built yet! But it's still nice for a stroll and to see some really awesome trees. More

title: Paradise for Photography
review_text: Famous for the sun set and photographers delight, must visit place. Pure white sands, humming of birds and sound of blue waves of sea, will relax your mind. Amazing view of sunset especially. Highly recommended for nature lovers.

title: Andaman trip
review_text: Amazing views esp sunset ...take a trek on the hilltop thro the rainforest till the suicide point (i think its called!) ..simply breathtaking picture of the sea, hills and forest

title: Good for sunset
review_text:
This is little far from port blair but one can go for it once. 
This place is mainly famous for sun set. there are few good spots for photography etc...

title: Terrible!
review_text: Not worth the visit. It is quite far from the city. I visited during the low tide. It simply looked quite ordinary.

title: Excellent, picturesque location during sunset
review_text: This place is is nice to roam around during sunset. The hilly terrain to reach this place is equally beautiful and one can enjoy a perfect evening out. The sea beach is rocky one cannot go in, but there is a park adjacent with huge trees & greenery makes this location perfect for taking pictures. It is 30-35 KM away from Portblair and takes around 45 mins to 1 hrs due to narrow & steep roads. Contrary to the name suggests there are no birds 'Chidiya' to view, our guide told us that the actual location to watch birds is on the way uphill near the beach.

title: Perfect place
review_text: This beach is so pretty that I ended up being there for 3 hours, though my cab driver was cribbing. So I asked him to comeback after 3 hours. Make sure u keep enough time in your hand when u go there.

title: Picture Postcard Sunset
review_text: Located in the south of Port Blair about 40 mins from the main city it is a reserve forest with spectacular sunset view. Small shops serving coconut water etc makes it a nice evening outing.

title: Amazing place
review_text: This place is really scenic and beautiful. The water is sky blue and clean. It's around 45 minutes drive from Port Blair and the drive is scenic too. There is a sign board before the entrance which warns you about the last sighting of crocodile/alligator which was in the month of January when we went. It's surrounded by huge trees and the beach is clean.

title: Best Sunset Point_port blair
review_text: Great place to enjoy the sunset. Tsunami affected area so, you will see some tree branches are surviving beside the seashore & looking so beautiful .

title: Superb sun set
review_text: We drove down to Chidiya Tapu from Port Blair. Beach was nice with clear water. There were some dead trees on the beach.Banks were full of trees with song of different birds. Wave was mild and the sun set behind the hills.

title: One of the best beaches of port blair
review_text:
This is the sunset point and so people line up here to see the sun setting in the sea...amazing view! 
Drive up to this place is no less mesmerizing. Serpentine roads with greenery on both sides.

title: A paradise for photo lovers
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is a beach off from the hustle and bustle of Port Blair. The place is so calm and awesome for some brilliant snaps. The beach stretch has a separate place to have a dip well guarded by nets as a precaution against salt water crocodiles! The last sighting of a crocodile was during end of January 2016 (as of March 2016). The water is crystal clear and a must visit attraction in Port Blair

title: Not impressive
review_text: I think it's not so impressive.. Radhanagar beach sunset was far better ... Also there you have to take bath inside the netted area... Which is very unusual in beach side

title: Vacations
review_text: Awesomeness is the only word for this place. Trekking can be done to reach other end of the island. Sunset is good and above all the coconut water is very sweet.

title: A good place for kids to enjoy and a nice small trek for adventure
review_text:
The place is very silent and calm. The water was so calm and no waves and I initially thought that its some water reservoir. I confirmed from that life guard and he mentioned that its sea. I was not able to believe. There are shower and changing room facility at the beach. There is a small play area for the kids with swings and 'log in and log out'. Its a kids friendly place. If you are bit adventurer, there is a trek of about 1.5 km at the end of the beach which I did with my kid till half way. We could hear the birds singing in the melodious sounds. I do not know the name of those birds but the voice was good for ears. Please make sure you step carefully without making noise when you go bit interior to hear the birds else the noise from the dry leaves when we walk will disturb the birds and they flew away. The trees are very tall so its not possible to identify the birds and I am not a bird watcher or expert. But you can still enjoy the place. Once negative point to note is that female wash rooms were in pathetic condition and my wife could not use it and came back. title: superb sunset!!!
review_text: We had a chance to go to this lovely beach , we were there during the after noon time, our driver cum guide suggested us to visit Munda Pahad Beach just nearby to view the sunset which was awesome.

title: Waste of time
review_text: There is nothing much at this place that you can do. If you have to go there, please just rent a bike or something. Sunset is the only thing for which tourists visit this place which is also not that much superb. So a waste of time.

title: beautiful sunset
review_text:
one of the best place to see sunset. 
But in this place you will not find the best food or restaurant. So better take your meal and come around 2 or 3 pm and enjoy sunset around 5.30 pm.

title: Beautiful
review_text: The place is beautiful with a breathtaking sunset. The place shuts down at 5 so be there on time. Most of the people only come till the beach, if you walk to the end you will hit a trail which leads to the southern most point of portblair. The view from here is beautiful. Don't miss it. Avoid swimming in the waters

title: A photographers paradise !!
review_text: We visited Andamans during our Anniversary last week.. After spending the afternoon at Corvyns Cove beach we decided on spending the evening at ChidiyaTapu.. Scenic beauty during sunset.. Made our anniversary memorable...And of course a photographers paradise..

title: loved it
review_text: This beach is one best beaches in Port Blair. The sunset is really nice. The beach is not that great for swimming but you can relax on the sand and watch the beautiful sunset

title: More Than Just a Sunset
review_text:
An hour's drive from Port Blair will bring you to Chidiya Tapu and the lovely small Munda Pahar beach area. 

The beach is well kept and there are some beautiful table and benches carved from tree trunks. 

It is a popular area for locals who come for a few hours with their picnics to enjoy the beach. 

Bathing in the sea has to be undertaken with caution as salt water crocodiles have been known to frequent the area. I did not spot one! 

I think the journey itself to reach this beach is interesting and whether you come to see the sunset or just visit during the day the trip is worth the effort. More

title: Great place for Sunset
review_text: Amazing chilled out place.. One of the best sunset views that i have ever seen. The beachline is beautiful as well.

title: The Tsunami effect
review_text: The only reason one would want to visit this place is to see the huge uprooted trees left by the devastating tsunami of 2004. This region is very isolated with crocodile infested waters. Getting here needs a boring 2 hours drive through dense forests and you are advised to get out of here before it gets dark. The police personnel from the forest department do a strict patrolling in this region.

title: Nice Sunet Point
review_text:
This place is little far from the city. But really beautiful Sun Set. 
If you have time then go visit. 
there is small tea place on the way and makes nice tea and coffee

title: Serene, Tranquil etc etc :)
review_text: I was blown away by the serenity of this place... It's a short drive away from Port Blair. A stretch of winded car ride amidst tall tall trees and you reach the entrance of a park sort of area. Saunter inside and you see the most calm waters ever! There is a cordoned off safe area where anyone from 8 - 80 can wade about if they feel like it. Must visit for anyone hydrophobic, ideal place to overcome your fear!

title: Beach
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text: Quiet beach. Good for taking pictures during sunset. Nothing to boast about otherwise. Not really worth a visit.

title: The Horizon view and the Golden Sunset
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text:
Located about 17 kms from Port blair (30-40 mins by car), Chidiya Tapu is known for the 180 degree view of the horizon and the amazing golden Sunset. 
Reach Chidiya Tapu by car, spend some time on the beach and prepare yourself for the 3 kms trek through the jungle to reach the southern most point of the South Andaman Island. The trek might seem a little tiring for the first timers, but when you reach the destination, all the sweating seems worth. Sit there and relax.. Forget every worry, just look at the infinity and enjoy the beautiful setting sun.

title: Tourists in Andaman must not miss it
review_text:
Excellent beach, the forest at the back adds different shade to its beauty. The dead tree trunks right on the beach is photographers' delight. Pls. visit during the sun set. You wll cherish its experience life long. Just amazing! 

Pls. must arrange your private vehicle, because loacl trasportation (bus) is not available to the Mundapahar beach (the best point at Chdiya Tapu).

title: Wonderful sight
review_text: I know it's kind of a cliche to talk about beautiful sunsets, especially when speaking of beach towns, but, this place is certainly worth a visit. It's not just the view of the setting sun but also the view of the sea that hits you when you first access the place after driving through the mountains. Spend one evening here and you won't ever forget this place!

title: Nice sunset point, but far away and not very well maintained
review_text: It takes around 1 hr to reach Chidiya tapu from Port Blair, but the sunset view from there was beautiful and we could click some great pics there. However, I sincerely thought this could have been maintained / developed better. There is a very small hut type thing to watch the sunset and it will be already crowded even if there are only 5-6 people in there. Since sunset is so momentary, don't forget to reach there in time if you don't want to miss it.

title: Nice evening reflection time
review_text: My husband has seen many sunsets but I was working in corporate for four years , I missed watching sunsets because I left late after sunset. This one is special because there is a river and hill ranges which you can see from this point. If you reach early, you can go to a park close by and spend some time there. Very limited shops so take your munchies alongwith you.

title: Picture perfect sunset view...
review_text: Journeys to Chidiya Tapu from Port Blair was itself scenic and amazing. Chidiya tapu is known for its sunset point and truly it is the best sunset view I have seen till date.

title: Ideal for scenery and a little wildlife.
review_text: I decided to bring my parents to this place, Chidiya Tapu also known as Bird Island or Sunset point. This is located on the southern tip of Port Blair. It is quite a long drive from the city to here with all the bent roads and numerous villages and rocky bays along the way but the scenic views both on the journey and at the location is breath-taking and for those who just want to relax and spend the time away, this is well worth a visit. There is a large car park that can get full quite quickly so it is best to plan wisely and a fee applies to gain entry to the park and the surrounding forest and beach. There are some huts around the park provided shade and shelter and there are some tree variations and different species of birds that flock to this area and each of them have their own sound and appearance. There is even a small mangrove forest nearby by the beach. Take care when walking along the coast as the sand is very soft and washed up rocks and debris can be a trip hazard. Besides that, the view of the sea, coastline and small islands are terrific and weather permitting and if the sky is clear you may be lucky enough to observe a sunset with various colours painting the skyline that stays in your mind forever. title: Awesome sunset.
review_text: This is the southernmost tip of mainland about 30-40 kms away from main city. Must visit place. Do visit in the evening for beautiful sunset. Relax on the beach, listen to the soft breaking of waves and see the sun setting behind the mountains.

title: A decent attraction, often ignored by package makers
review_text: It has a wildlife sanctuary, and the journey is relaxing. You pass a lot of dense forests to reach the place. All in all, a decent place to visit while in Port Blair

title: Best Place to watch sunset and photography
review_text: It took us almost 50 min. to reach there from Port Blair middle point, road is pretty curvy with hairpin kind; so for those having motion sickness its advisable to take medicine with you. Chidiyatapu It is the southern most tip of island and also said to be the best place for bird lovers. Its also said to be a home for more than 46 kind of native birds; although we could see only 2 kind :-) since we visited this place in evening to enjoy the sunset. As per locals if you want to watch the birds come very early in morning. This place is also one of the best place on island to enjoy the sunset as you have lush green forest on one side sand and water in between and mountain on the other side. There are few swings and sliding available so little kids can also enjoy the place. See the pics there is a family play area in water which is well fenced with net and safe for small children also. There are many hidden place one can find, at the end of main beach if you go straight there is a small trail through the island which will guide you towards the other side of beach; that place is just awesome for those who want tranquillity, a very peaceful and serene place you can sit, relax and rest is solitude. title: Natures Paradise Serenity
review_text:
Once you arrive in Andaman one of the trips you need to make is to Chidya Tapu 

I arrived Port Blair by Jet Airways which landed and I settled in my hotel by around 3.00. I hired a bike and Rode all the way to Chidya tapu with my Wife and reached there by 4.00 but unfortunalty came to know that it is closing by 5.00 pm so try to reach there early. The Drive is around approx 27 kms you tend to get confused a bit with the splitting roads but you get lot of local help all the way till Chidya tapu. The last 3 kms is lots of Up and down the hill. But once you reach there it is an awesome place. Try to reach this spot as early as possible as they close dowwn by around 5.00pm . You can have a swim in the sea they have safety nets where you can swim without any tensions of sea creatures. Beautiful spot to take portraits 

you can spot lots of Birds there also. More

title: One step in the direction of a Daliesque painting.
review_text:
A minimum of four to five hours is required to thoroughly enjoy this place and the little areas that lead to this Bird Isle(Chidya Tapu). Interestingly, not many birds as i thought would be. 

From the uprooted horizontal tree to the trek towards Suicide(Sunset) Point; those who love to walk and explore, this is a nice area to do so. There are little hidden spots here and there. 

The sunset is spectacular, which seems to be pretty much anywhere around these islands. 

Standing still on a late afternoon with dense lushness all around had a soothing effect on me.

title: Try to avoid
review_text:
Really nothing to do here - visit this place only if you have visited Samudrika Museum, Cellular jail, have done watersports & Sea walking in Port Blair and you are still left to kill some time in Port Blair (and you are not the types who likes relaxing back at your hotel). Even in such a case reach this place by 3:30 PM (not before that - you could be the first ones to be visiting and feel real odd) 

Quick tips: 
1. Reach by 3:30 
2. Photo sessions till 4:30 [many avenues present to click pictures - especially the large trees that fell in the Tsunami and Indian government has ensured that they are not cleaned up to ensure nature gets a chance to evolve the way it can naturally) 
3. Grab a Kulfi by 4:30 (the guy will walk in around 4:00 PM) and take some tree bark as your sitting point 
4. By 4:45 PM sunset begins - enjoy your view. More

title: Good Sunset Point
review_text: A wonderful place to see the sunset. The place is opened till sunset and one has to hurry up to leave as soon as the sun sets. As per the locals a good point to watch birds if reached early morning.

title: A relatively unexplored heaven!!
review_text: This is an absolutely beautiful place....a 45 min drive from port Blair it is relatively unexplored since there were hardly any people when we went there..good place to have a bath ..they have safe zoned an area for swimming..there are wooden logs for sitting and lush green mangroves by the beach..a must visit..on the way back you can also visit Corbyn cove and enjoy chilled beer at waves bar.

title: Bike Ride from Port Blair ~40km!
review_text:
We with a group of friends went on a loooong bike ride from port blair to chidiyatapu just to see the sunset. 
It was the longest bike ride I ever had which went through small villages, a reserve forest and a beautiful scenic sea side road. 

Travelling so much was worth all the effort because once you reach there the sunset is the most beautiful thing you have ever seen.

title: The place to watch Sunset
review_text: It's about an hours drive though the forest. Try to be there before 2pm. Walk along the unspoilt beach.The bamboo bridge is pretty. Finally enjoy the sunset before heading back to the hotel room. There are few breathtaking spots on the way back. Just ask the cab driver.... he knows the best spots to take few shots

title: Wonderful Place to visit
review_text: It is a beautiful place for nature loving persons. It is really wonderful place to visit. A full day visit. Can bath in sea and walk around the forest and must see SUNSET.

title: Nice...Sunset...Relaxing...Picturesque Beach
review_text:
Its about an hr drive away from Port Blair...Go for sunset view, relaxing and pictures. 
The access road is in good condition and passes through trees and forest. The beach is calm, clean and sandy. If you are staying in Port Blair for a day or two plan a visit to this place..wroth spending spare time and relaxation...You can either go swimming or for a small trek nearby. The sunset view is really superb.

title: Small beach accessed through dense forest
review_text: A small beach with very calm water. Actually this beach looks like a big lake. It was a good experience of driving though dense forest to reach this beach. Can spend good time with family/friends

title: Breathtakingly beautiful
review_text: A great beach, beautiful views, less crowds. Scuba, boat rides, and an excellent biological park. This was one of our favorite places in Andaman.

title: Rocky Beach - cant swim. Go only to relax
review_text:
1. Cant swim, its a rocky beack 
2. Too far from the main city - hire a cab 
3. Go before sunset as apparently this beach has a nice evening view 
4. Forest and driftwood on the beach lend it a different look 
5. Calm beach - no waves - no activities. Go here only for the view and calm time 
6. Can be slightly crowded as many people come to watch the sunset 
7. Even if you do not visit this beach you wont miss out on much

title: Awesome sunset beach :)
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is one beach you shouldn't miss while in Andaman. It is about 30 km from Port Blair but the visit is worth. The sunset view is awesome. You can spend an entire evening on this beach either swimming in the sea or taking a small trek by the nearby hillock.

title: An excellent beach and ideal location for Sunset
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is located 25 kms South of Port Blair and takes about 45 minutes to get there by car. The beach is located on the furthest Southern tip of South Andaman Island. It is one of the best places to see the sunset in Port Blair. Chidiya Tapu Biological Park, Chidiya Tapu Beach, and the Sylvan Sands and Munda Pahar beaches are the prime attractions. The beaches are a paradise for collectors of sea shells because different varieties of colorful shells lie strewn all around.

title: Nice beach!!
review_text:
Chidiya tapu is around an hour drive from port Blair... The beach is calm and not at all crowded.... Have heard that it's very good for its picturesque sunset... But since we were there during day, so couldn't view the sunset... But the beach was good and calm... Just to go and spend time with family and friends.... Enjoyed time clicking loads and loads of pictures.... 
Not quite in league as of jolly buoy beach/ radhanagar beach... But still it can be visited for the calmness it offers.... No crowd at all!!

title: Too long way to go for just another andaman beach
review_text: its an over-hyped attraction...nothing spectacular and it can be avoided if you are running out of time...Its a long way away from port blair and you go there to see sunset which is also seen fro so many places in port blair itself....there is a small trek to a suicide point which we went...good trekking through forest and then you reach a vintage point from where you can see and hear giant waves dashing against rocks...no birds to see at chidiya tapu !!!!!!!!!!!

title: Place to relax on sand beach outside city
review_text: Approx.14 kms far from city but can be easily reached by private auto rickshaw, taxis. This place offers swimming area in sea with option to relax on sandy beach with picture perfect locations.

title: Not worthy to spend time
review_text: Peaceful place but not worthy of excitement or beach fun. One can avoid to see it and opt for some other beach.

title: A pictursque sandy beach
review_text: We had a great time here with my family. All we did the whole day was dive into the sea and play ball. If you are on a long vacation I would suggest spending some more time and making it a small family picnic with packed lunch.

title: Good outing for half a day
review_text: It's a good outing for half a day. The drive is good through thick forest. The bean is clean and showe area is also well planned.

title: Natural beauty
review_text: This is very clam and quite island, sun set view from this island is very beautiful. One of the danger is sea crocodiles.

title: the most beautiful sunset!!!
review_text: I have done a fare bit of travelling, but haven't seen such a beautiful sunset ever.... completely worthwhile... in fact the trip to this place itself is beautiful

title: Chidyatapu.... The Island of Birds...!!
review_text:
Chidyatapu is a beach around 30 km away from the city.... the drive to the destination itself is a mesmerizing one. One starts to Chidyatapu from the POrt Blair city, then through small villages to the lovely shore road and then into the green dense forest and finally to the lovely beach. Chidyatapu in recent time have come up with the some great add ons. The forest Dept have developed a very huge Biological Park which is very huge and now is equipped with battery operated cab for the tourist for the complete park tour. They charge somewhere around Rs.20/- per head for entry and Rs.50/- for the tour. 

The Sylvan beach is one of the most neat beaches of Andaman open for tourist with properly fenced swimming area for safety.One can also enjoy the natural trek to the Mundapahad which is around 3 km in total and gives the adventure freaks a beautiful view and photographs the nest shots. 

A complete day can be spent at the destination but as there is no food stall at the location so suggest the travels to make proper arrangement of food and water. More

title: Sunset
review_text: Chidiya Tapu lets you experience the beautiful colours of the sea and sky during sunset. Also try the trek to silversands beach on the other side of the island. It's gorgeous. Carry beer/water :)

title: Superb view point!!
review_text:
This place is about 1-1.5 hours by car from Port Blair. The view on the way is absolutely wonderful. We went there in the afternoon. Starting around 3 PM we reached the beach aroud 4 PM. From the beach you need to trek through forest and hilly area for about 25-30 minutes to reach the top of the hill. 
And once you reach there, what a beautiful sight awaits you. The blue ocean all around, small islands far away, a small hill with cave like openings at the bottom of the hill, waves spashing and braking against the hill and the sun setting down on the horizon!! 
Absolutely breathtaking....

title: Quite retreat with short beach length
review_text: There are couple of trees which are artistic in look and a wooden bridge under which a stream of water runs .very enchanting ! very few ventures in to sea here .A nice one hour experience

title: Nice place to visit clear beach
review_text: You can hike but make sure it is before 3 pm you can swim but be ware of crocodile.nice spot for picnic area.good spot for sunset amazing love it.Carry. Raincoat or umbrella with you.

title: Excellent picnic spot with strikingly shallow water
review_text: It's a must visit place if you are in andaman, I hired a cab from Port Blair. It's famous for its sunset view. The water is unbelievably shallow and crystal clear I moved like 60 metres in to the water and the water was around my knees the jungle is dense and benches are carved out of tree log it looks really nice. This place is a scenic beauty, picturesque, arresting, charming and pleasant. Photographers do visit this place. You can visit alone or with friends or family this place is just awesome and very much different from beaches.

title: Clear beach and nice view.
review_text: We enjoyed very much here. Actually it is a picnic spot too. Many families gather and there. The local kulfi was very very tasty and a cost of only Rs. 20.

title: nice little trip while in Port Blair
review_text: The place is considered a great place to watch the sunset and it closes at 5!! but it's a nice place to visit while at Port Blair. Good fun to climb on low hanging trees, sit on benches made from logs and having the best nariyal pani (tender coconut water) ever!

title: Best sunset point
review_text: If u want to c sunset then it's chidiyatapu.. This is the thumb rule and its true also... Very beautiful drive from port Blair ... And when u reach here u will feel that this place is special.. Recommended to bring good camera for beautiful sunset pics.. Must place to visit..

title: Incredible sunset point & Photographer's delight
review_text:
One of best locations to watch sunset. It takes around 50 mins to reach there from Port Blair city centre. The road to get there is quite secluded and there are quite a few scenic spots on the way. The waters are really calm and even kids can enjoy a swimming session. But the main attraction here is the scenic beauty. Fallen Mohua trees add to the charm. Walk for a while, complete your photography sessions and then sit on a fallen tree trunk and enjoy the sunset. 
TIP- REACH THERE BY 3 PM TO MAKE FULL USE OF YOUR TRIP THERE

title: Excellent sunset point
review_text:
Excellent sunset point. Best among the three best sunset points in the whole of Andaman Island. The other two are Radhanagar Beach in Havelock Island and Lakshmanpur Beach in Neil Island. 

You should travel little further to reach the Munda Pahad to see the beach there. I would rate that this should not be missed when you visit Chidiya Tappu. The reflection of sea and the mountains on the Rutland Island make a great viewing of sunset from Chidiya Tappu 

You see Giant Trees here in Munda Pahad, which have been uprooted and lying on the beach the spectacle is some thing to be seen and experienced. 

Great place to use your ultra-wide angle lenses .. More

title: Dont miss this .... Amazing
review_text: The Chidiya tapu is the southernmost tip and about 30 plus kms from port blair. We can travel by Govt bus or hire a rick or cab for a 45-50 minute journey. The beach is serene with large trees and white sand, The sunset point at this beach is wonderful abd there is a nice biological garden situated about 2 kms away ... Dont miss this when in Port Blair

title: Disappointed - no such rare birds found
review_text: Not sure if we were there on the correct time, but unfortunately we did not notice any rare species migratory birds here. We had been in Jan, during the early morning.

title: One time visit
review_text: The place is about 30kms away from the main Port Blair city with a drive of an hour between the sea shore. Water is not so clear but scenery is good.So if you are pressed for time then you can give it a skip.

title: BreathTaking Sunset
review_text:

Best sunset Beach

title: Beautiful place for sunset & beach frolic
review_text: The chidiya Tapu about 30 kms from Port Blair is a pristine beach on the southernmost tip of South andaman. It has a beautiful setting with lot of tsunami era large tree trunks strategically placed on the beach. The sunset here is wonderful as well as the biological park around. Must visit around 4 pm in evening to cover all aspects

title: best sunset views
review_text: chidiyatapu beach and the munda pahad beach are famous for their sun set views...and its a must visit.

title: Wonderful place - must visit
review_text:
Little far away from Portblair main city (approx 30 km). Will take 50 minutes to 1 hour from main city. The interesting thing of Chidiya Tapu is one can visit in the afternoon to see the sunset or visit in early morning for bird watching. Though there are no special kind of birds but it's kinda awesome feelings in the morning time. Here are few points that I would like to point out - 1. No restaurants near by. But taste local kulfi there. It's tasty. 2. No hotels/resort near by, but there are several resorts and hotel in 10 kms diameter. 3. can book a car @1000-1500 to visit Chidiya tapu from Main city or take auto also, if you have budget constraint. 4. One can do some little trekking from the shore of Chidiya Tapu to Kala Pathar passing through dense forest. 5. if you are visiting in the afternoon, try to reach this place before 4:20 pm, otherwise, you might miss the sunset. In October time, sunset happens between 4:30 to 4:50 pm. 6. One can take a ferry (if available to visit a near by small island) 7. Closing time in October was 5:0 pm. Overall, I would rate this place 10 out of 10 as the best sunset in POrtblair, you can see from here. The scenic beauty (combination of forest, sea, uprooted trees and sunset) will definitely amaze you. The overall journey and visit... Little far away from Portblair main city (approx 30 km). Will take 50 minutes to 1 hour from main city. The interesting thing of Chidiya Tapu is one can visit in the afternoon to see the sunset or visit in early morning for bird watching. Though there are no special kind of birds but it's kinda awesome feelings in the morning time. 

Here are few points that I would like to point out - 
1. No restaurants near by. But taste local kulfi there. It's tasty. 
2. No hotels/resort near by, but there are several resorts and hotel in 10 kms diameter. 
3. can book a car @1000-1500 to visit Chidiya tapu from Main city or take auto also, if you have budget constraint. 
4. One can do some little trekking from the shore of Chidiya Tapu to Kala Pathar passing through dense forest. 
5. if you are visiting in the afternoon, try to reach this place before 4:20 pm, otherwise, you might miss the sunset. In October time, sunset happens between 4:30 to 4:50 pm. 
6. One can take a ferry (if available to visit a near by small island) 
7. Closing time in October was 5:0 pm. 

Overall, I would rate this place 10 out of 10 as the best sunset in POrtblair, you can see from here. The scenic beauty (combination of forest, sea, uprooted trees and sunset) will definitely amaze you. 

The overall journey and visit time in Chidiya tapu from main city will be of total 3 hours. so plan accordingly. More

title: Wooden Crafts
review_text:
Beautiful wooden crafts one can see here. One can spend 1/2 hour 
here in city tour. We have purchased few items from the craft shop.

title: Average beach

title: Sunset beach (if the clouds are merciful!)
review_text:
Touted as the beach where a beautiful sunset can be witnessed, Chidiyatapu beach invited us through a foresty drive that was quite enchanting. However, I found the beach to be quite average, with the rocks spoiling the look of it. There was a group playing loud music on the shore, destroying the calmness imminent in the surroundings, annoying to say the least. We settled down on some wooden benches for some photos and then wandered in the shallow, rocky waters where we saw a Stingray up close ! Sadly, the clouds didn't cooperate so we had to return without witnessing the sunset. 

Coconut water, tea, biscuits, chips are available in stalls by the shore. More

title: Nice one

title: My experience was way too awesome

title: nice place to see sunset

title: Good half day out
review_text:
Another good half day trip and pretty much the cheapest one if you get stuck in Port Blair. The government bus can take you out there for a few rupees. You will be left close to the Forest Department Resthouse. Walk inland for a couple of minutes and you will find yourself in front of the Nature Park. We usually don’t like zoos, but this one was really low key and quite enjoyable, with few animals in large enclosures, all in a natural forest setting. Our friends visited with children, who absolutely loved it. 
From there it is a 20 minute walk South to get to the beach. Nice picnic spot and good to socialize with locals. As beaches in the Andamans go pretty disappointing, but we just got back from Radhanagar, so could consider ourselves a bit spoilt. More

title: Sunset paradise
review_text: A great place to view the sunset. You are allowed to stay at the Munda Pahad beach only till 5PM though. There is a long stretch of road from where you can view the beautiful sunset. We were unlucky as we were there on a very hazy day with lots of clouds. In spite of that the sunset was quite spectacular.

title: Nice place for bird lovers but very over-rated beach
review_text:

Basically go there only if you are huge fan of birds and want to observe them otherwise there is not much to do on this place . 
we saw sunset and planned to return to our place in port blair by taking an auto ride back

title: The most beautiful sunset I have ever seen
review_text:
I have been told, that we were lucky to see one of the most beautiful sunset panorama there is. I don't what makes Chidiya Tapu so special, but we happened to see the sun set in the Chidiya Tapu Marine Park accidentally, when we were returning from Cinque island, and our boat could not make it to the dock because of the low tide. The sunset was red , gold, pink, orange, with a hue of green. It was beautiful and I was at peace. 

The Park by itself is not much; the water is clean and cool, and when the tide is low it recedes pretty far from the actually beach, and you can walk pretty far in the shallow water. But it is the sunset which pretty much had us all mesmerized (see picture in post). I wish I had a better camera to capture all the hues. Words are simply not enough. More

title: Excellent experience at an amazing sunset beach
review_text:
Chidiya Tapu (Bird Island) is 45 minutes by a cab from Port Blair. Plan your visit to reach there at least an hour before sunset time because Chidiya Tapu has an amazing sunset beach. What you see is an amazing riot of colours as the sun dips behind a background hill with an expanse of water in front. Mesmerising view. The entrance to the beach has eco sit outs for visitors with log cut seating and 'sofas' dug out of 'sea mohva' tree trunks. A few swings keep the children occupied. What is wonderful is that the beach and forest has been kept off limits of food stalls and vendors that normally dot so many other beaches in India. Result = an unlittered beach and unpolluted forest. 
Adjacent to it is the Munda pahad ( a forested hill). A 1.5 kilometre trek through a mangrove forest gets you to a view point at the island's souther tip which gives amazing views of the sea on three sides. More

title: Chidiya Tapu
review_text: Good small beach, beware of crocodiles, netting done by government, clean clear crisp water to enjoy, knee deep water, huge trees seating arrangements at end, good for watching sun set.

review_text:

review_text: Its a nice beach in the lap of nature. It takes around 2 hour from port blare by car. It will be more romantic if there are rains during the visit.

title: Third rated Shoreline
review_text: This place is part of the itineraries of my package tour of the Andaman island.I wont classify it as a decent beach, merely a shoreline which you can find anywhere around the coasts, infested with boulders both onshore and offshore.It is nowhere compared to Radhanagar beach, for the matter, not even close to Elephanta Beach in Havelock Island.The water is not clear and the shoreline is dirty with rubbish scattered all over the place.If your intention is to swim or go snorkelling, then dont waste your time here,rather spend it wisely in Havelock Island.There are lots of fallen trees along the coastline,I suppose its the destruction caused by tsunami.The only positive thing about this place is sunset watching at sunset point which is acceptable, otherwise pack your bags and leave without a second thought. title: The road that must be traveled!
review_text: Been here many a times over 2 visits to A&N. August 2005 & August 2014. More than the actual place itself, the drive to Chidiyatapu is really good. The road runs along the coastline and many a times, the winding road suddenly opens up to reveal the azure, blue sea shimmering in the sunlight. Then of course you enter dense forest which awes you seeing the sheer height of the trees and the diameter of the trunks. While Chidiyatapu itself boasts of little more than a stretch of beach, the surroundings have become much cleaner, and in a 'hats off' moment to whoever had the idea, they have carved out benches and tables out of the giant trees that were felled by the tsunami. Yes, there are no eating joints around so one would do well to carry snacks and beverages. Otherwise, just a couple of kilometres before reaching the place, there is the Wildgrass Resort on the right hand side. It's a little off the main road but doesnt disappoint you with its food, charming location and its beer! Perfect to relax and while away the afternoon before catching a glimpse of the setting sun and heading back to Port Blair! More
