title: On top the world
review_text:
I felt as if I was on the top of the world when trekked the hills. 

The picturesque view from this place was fabulous. The throw towards the open sea gave an awesome epilogue to our Andaman visit. 

The height and the view from the topmost part of Chidiya Tapu is something which can't be explained by words...it's something which can only be perceived. 

The sunset, though I wasn't lucky enough to get the entire episode, is again one of the attractions of the place. The uprooted trees are very similar to Wandoor, score better, as were ideal for family photo. 

The entire hang-out is one of the favourites of the island. 

On the way back to city there was a place where the rocks are naturally formed like apes, is again quite splendid "nazara". 

In nutshell thoroughly enjoyed few hours and they simply got exhausted in no time....... More

I had a good imagination in mind about this beach and especially about the sunset reading articles etc but as soon as we reached the place I couldnt hide my disappointments.... crowded, dirty area, disgusting WC (some friends had to use and got seriously sick afterwards), even changing rooms are used as toilets, no comments..... the beach is definitely not for swimming and relaxation because of "Be aware of crocodiles" sign and the sunset point is not any better or different than other places. It was a waste of time travelling all way down for more than an hour but now I at least know how the place looks like in reality and tick the box and to those who still want to go would recommend to visit Chidiya Tapu before visiting the Radhanagar beach, save the best for last :-) More

review_text:

<1> Watch the sunset and enjoy the beach near Chidiya Tapu. 
<2> There is another Sunset spot a little before the first spot mentioned above. You should be able to cover both of them for one sunset. 
<3> Munda pahar is 1.5 kms trail from Chidiya Tapu beach. I could visit that because of time constraint. You should definitely be there by 3:00 pm if you want to go there. Otherwise if you reach there by 4:00 - 4:30 pm, that should be fine.

title: A fantastic beach hideaway

The beach is very clean, with some added attractions towards the walkway that leads to the beach. From the parking you have to walk some 100 meters to the beach and here you have nicely made sititng arrangements (made out of wood) and some activity options. There is also one suspended bridge (a very small one) but you will like it. The beach is also very good with crystal clear waters. The setting is like beach bordering a jungle. There are some trees uprooted during Tsunami and I somehow felt that adds to the charm. You can just enjoy in water or view sunset and then drive back to Port Blair. More

title: journey is sweeter than destination
review_text:
Chidiya tapu, and adjoining munda pahar beach, is quite far from city but is quite worth the effort. If you are not a family group, please rent a bike (I took from saro travels -splendour @ INR 300) and make a point to ride. I assure you this would be one of the memorable road trips you may take in your life. The site is quite far from city and traverses through country side first. later, it meanders along coast with open beach and guys, if the sun is not hard on you, you will just want to keep on riding. The picture is so beautiful! After you have crossed the sea-coast ride, you would enter a reserved forest and the gentle coolness of the air will kiss you on your cheeks.. It feels like bliss. There are birds chirping or something and you are totally floated. Chidiya tapu is a basically a chidiya ghar or a small zoo (entry fee of INR 20) where you find crocodiles, deers, wild boars etc. While that may or may not attract, you are going to like the walking trails and the backdrop of sea and mountains. Flash your camera and you are like standing behind a poster. title: Birds Island
review_text:
Chidiya means birds and Tapu is a p-lace or island. Chidiya Tapu is a small village is at 25kms from Port Blair. It is full of flourishing green mangroves and a calm island. The forest here is bestowed with numerous chirping birds. It is an ideal picnic spot in Andaman. 
There is a rich collection of birds, white spotted deer and orchids. The sky here, as I saw, is filled with number of species of birds like, hanging parrot, scarlet minivet, emerald dove, long-tailed and red-breasted parakeets, white-bellied sea eagles and grey-fronted and imperial green pigeons and many more. Apart from attracting birds there are wild pigs and barking deers in this forest and enjoy the saltwater crocodile spotting. 

It is a Biological Park. You will enjoy the panoramic view of the entire village as well as islands from the forest guest house at the top the hillock. Bright corals are alive here. It is an excellent site for snorkelling. There are varieties of sea shells because of shell craft is a prime industry here. Items like Table lamp, ashtray, bangles and decorative boxes are important products sold in this island. 

You can enjoy boat trips from here to Cinque Island. More

title: Chiriatapu (Munda Pahar)
review_text: The sea and forest unite to give you the perfect charm of serene nature at Chiriatapu, also known as Munda Pahar. About 45 minutes drive from Port Blair. Adjoining marshy area is the inhabiting place of shallow water crocodiles, and you see the baby crocs jumping around. Not good for bathing as the water is shallow, but worth a visit for watching the magnificent sunset from nearby guest house. The authorities clear the beach by 5pm. title: Munda Pahad Beach and Chidiya Tapu sunset point - good places
review_text:
We traveled to Chidiya Tapu on the last day of our 7 day trip to Andamans. We went to this point from our hotel, a good 1 hour's drive.This point is a sunset point overlooking the ocean and hills, and a very calm and quiet place. On days without any clouds, sunset here is said to be the best across the Andamans. It was truly a very serene experience, and we enjoyed the sunset sitting on large stones a couple of metres into the sea. 

If one is coming here all the way from Port Blair, then it does make sense to leave a little early to have a dip at the Munda Pahad Beach 2-3 km away from Chidiya Tapu. An extremely good beach, with white soft sand and absolutely clear water. There are hardly any waves so children can enjoy the shallow waters for a distance. There were some interesting warning signs at the beach, for crocodiles and sharks, but there is a huge boat patrolling the waters and nothing to worry. 

Worth spending the latter half of the day here. More

review_text:
This place is 25 km from Port Blair and is a usual part of Andaman Itinerary. To visit this place, you need an afternoon till evening sunset. 

The place is a perfect example of the serenity of nature, unspoiled by mankind. A few huts and the reclining beach chairs blend with nature and are made with natural materials. No wonder why sun too gives an amazing setting view here. 

The beach is so artistic by itself, with a tinge of sorrow with fallen trees around, a few lone rocks emerging from the calm enclosure of Indian Ocean and a very thick vegetation opposite to it. Nature boasts here style statement here with the combination. 

One tea stall with a few snack options is the only eatery you'll find here. That too is mobile and starts by evening. Spend a few hours staring at the sea from a wooden long chair, under the canopy of tall evergreen trees, with only the noise of cool breeze patting you to sleep.. Ah!! I miss that place like anything. 

For people who have come early and wanting to do something extra can visit a Zoological Park near the beach. More

title: Romantic Sunset
review_text: Andaman has some very well known resplendent beaches with crystal clear azure sea kissing the blue dome of sky....but in most of the beaches, either you get to visit them during the daytime and return much before sunset, or the sun goes down opposite to the sea.So people who love to see the red sun going down the sea with a riot of colours taking over the blue salty water, Chidiya Tapu is one of the best options. This place is about 30 minutes drive from Port Blair, the road condition is pretty good and you can reach there well before sunset, take out your camera, set the tripod and wait for all the magic to happen right before your eyes. This beach is not for bathing, though i found some people frolicking under the evening sun, it is definitely not advised as there are large boulders everywhere. This area was hit by Sumnami and when I visited, large uprooted trees were strewn around all over the beach, giving lovely subjects as foreground for the photographer and also creating an eerie atmosphere. review_text: This place looks like heaven.. Uprooted tree.. crystal clear water.. absolutely paradise.. I am glad there are no water sport happening here.. Only regret.. I wish I could spend more time.. This place needs to have a guest house so people can spend few days in this heaven ..

title: here the sun goes down...
review_text: you know one i would like to stress on and that is keeps your senses aware when you are in Andaman, reasons are very positive. its a very nice place filled with simplicity and nature shows its beauty. Chidiya Tapu is famous for its sunset. encounter the change of colour from daylight to twilight and night. while coming back to Port Blair keep your eyes across the sea...

review_text: Water is not so clear out here however the beach scenery is breathtaking. Uprooted Trees make an amazing artistic figures during the sunset, try capturing in B&W you will love those pictures..

title: Best Sunset view
review_text: It was located 25 Kms away from Port Blair and the main attraction was the Magnificent Sunset. It was one of the best sunset that I have watched so far.Do visit in the evening.

title: beautiful place
review_text: beautiful scenic beauty and real forest experience... want to visit more often... heard sounds of birds hardly able to locate any one of them...

title: Amazing
review_text: You have to see the sun set at Chidiya tapu...its amazing. Its a little off the main city, so the drive is very pretty too. Tsunami affects are still visible, the trees and the water, every bit will remind you off the devastating event. But OH! the sunset, not to be missed!

title: Sunset point
review_text: Since the weather was very cloudy and raining all the time we could not see the sun set but the place is beautiful. A must see by all tourists.

review_text: Do not expect any Chidiyas (birds) here. It's supposed to be a great sunset place - and for people that have never seen remote jungle roads, the ride to Chidiya Tapu is great. (I could not view the sunset first hand due to clouds)

title: Sunset
review_text: One can see a magnificient sunset @ Chidiya Tapu. You can see one of the tallest trees next to the beach. The proximity to the city is an added advantage

title: Beautiful drive and nice though crowded beach...
review_text:

It is a very popular place for watching the sun set. 
Definitely one of the few things not to be missed while in Port Blair, is barely an hour's drive from the city.

title: Amazing sunset
review_text:
Sky lit up like burning phoenix in flight after the sunset. very very shallow waters and we were all just lying down in water. 
great place for sunset

title: Great place for Bird Watcher
review_text: This is a great place for bird watcher but the beach has been washed out by Tsunami. Overall a nice place to spend a couple of hours with family and friends.

title: Scenic place, nice drive
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is about a one hour drive out of Port Blair. Once you leave the city the drive is quite scenic, passing through forests and along the sea. At Chidiya Tapu you can visit the Biological Park which houses some species endemic to Andamans such as the salt water crocodile, giant monitor lizard, wild boar, deer etc. The park would involve a fair bit of walking. Or you could just relax by the water, there is hardly anybody around and the views are nice. Some dive outfits have recently started operating there. Carry some eatables and water as there are no shops around. Chidiya Tapu is known for its sunsets which are spectacular. More

title: Great Sunset Point
review_text:
We loved this place. We visited this place to see the sunset from here. And we loved the sunset here. 

To visit Chidiya Tapu you need to pass a road fully surrounded by danced forest, a pleasant experience. 

Chidiya Tapu is a good place for photography too.

title: Cheers to the drive to Chidiya Tapu
review_text:
The drive to Chidiya Tapu is great- it's pretty picturesque. 
There is a park with species endmic to the Andamans, which was closed during my visit there.This is the highlight of Chiya Tapu and its sunset. 
However, we enjoyed snorkelling with Infinity Scuba, a private diving and snorkelling place on the Main Road.

title: Can be skipped
review_text: Can be skipped if you dont have plans of getting in to waters. Too much distance to be travelled to reach this place and nothing great to make the travel worth it!

title: Balas Chidiya Tapu visit
review_text: It takes about one hour from Portblair to Chidiya Tapu by road. The drive is very nice, pleasant as you will be going through forests, by the side of water streams, along the beach etc. At Chidiya Tapu the forest on one side, white sandy beach at the middle and transparent sea on the other side gives a beautiful view. One can spend any amount of time in sea water and enjoy the coolness of water and the moderate heat of the Sun. There are no other activities in this beach like water sports,snorkelling speed boating etc. The beach is so beautiful, one can take a long walk and enjoy the nature, listen to chirping, varieties of sounds made by birds enjoy the dark green trees, dead woods etc. Our visit concluded with viewing the Sun Set through the mountain, Sea. It was lovely to watch the Sun set associated with its Panoramic view, colour changes of sea water due to Sun light reflection. More

title: good place to watch sun set
review_text: This is one of the best places in Portblair to watch sun set. you could also bath in the sea here. Make sure to pack some snacks as there are no shops out there.

title: Good for birding
review_text: Secluded mangrove lagoon off the main beach afforded wonderful birding for two hours in the evening as the sun set.

title: Can be avoided
review_text: Chidiya Tapu is nothing great. They take you there for a Sunset. But then it is sunset on hill, not on sea. There are some fallen trees. And also it has a risk of crocodiles. ( risk but not always ).

title: avoid it if you can
review_text: there is nothing to see here and can be avoided. at a bit distance and after spending few hours , you feel what was the need to come

title: Great sunsets
review_text:
Chidiya Tapu is about 40 minutes from Port Blair so you need to leave by around 3 pm to get there in time for sunset (the Andamans are far East of the mainland and the sun sets by 5:30 in summer). 

There is a fairly okay beach where most of the general crowd will be seen playing around. Though the place is relatively busy, the area is pretty large so you can find a spot without encountering the entire population. The main attraction here are the sunset views, so take them in and then scoot.

title: The drive is very good.
review_text: The drive to the beach is very nice. The beach itself is secluded and picturesque. It leads to a crocodile inhabited forest. This beach can be visited more than once.

title: Relaxing Place
review_text: If you are on your honeymoon this will be the only place on portblair you will love to be at.the best time to be there is at by 4.00 pm in eve as the sunsets at 5.30 pm. so it gives u a good view of the setting sun.

title: Must Visit
review_text:
Beautiful sunsets made more beautiful by the dried roots and trunks of fallen trees. 
Spent some time with the fishermen, was fortunate to see a string ray and a puffer fish.

title: great sunset
review_text: the place has the best sunset in port blair and one of the best in andamans... nice way to spend your evening.... nice scenic beauty... the fallen trees make this beach even more beautiful.. still the mystry remains why is this called as chidiya tapu as we were not able to find any bird but the beach is a beauty in itself and the people who love photography will cherish this place

title: Not worth the visit
review_text: There was nothing unique about this beach.It is far away from from the main area.The water does not have a nice,crystal clear color.There are sign boards of warnings about crocodiles,but people do venture into the waters.There is no life guard or security in the area.Avoid noon time visit.

title: If you love nature this is the best place
review_text: The drive to this tapu is something one should not miss. It was as if one is driving through the jungle. For sometime we felt scared also because the drive quite long, The actual place is known as mundapahad ,The greenery around is to be seen only and can not be described in words

title: munda pahad beach -Its heaven
review_text:
When i reached Munda pahad - i still was not able to think if am really seeing a beach or am in a dreamland. The place is so serene and calm. Though we were not able to actually see the sunset due to the cloudy weather but the sunrays which were falling into the water from two different sides were mindblowing. My soul felt so pure and positive that time as if i am washed away by all the negativity and noises of the world. Felt so happy and in the lap of divine nature. 
The landscape was so pure and perfect. Everything from the branch of the tree to the pebbles and white sand were so enchanting. Munda pahad is a true beauty. 
I was surprised to see the beach is so different than other beaches. Here the water is calm without much waves. U can walk deep into the water still the water will reach to your knees only.U can hear the music of the birds and pure air touching you. 

This is the place to rest..try to give time to YOUrself only. 
I felt so lucky to have chosen such a divine place for our first marriage anniversary trip. 

P.S. I even saw one monster type lizard in bushes as people were taking its pics. Please be careful when u go near the bushes. More

title: wonderful Sunset Beach
review_text: The beach is situated alongside deep forest.Nice sun set point with beach. It is pretty clean and less crowded and sunset in this beach is mesmerizing . It is worth visiting this place when u are in andaman .Better to go in evening as one can enjoy the sunset.

title: Overrated
review_text: Nice sun set point with beach. There are variety of birds but jury is out on whether this is a must see tourist point in port blair. Perhaps a visit to nearby island would add more flavor to it.

It takes onehour drive from portblair to reach chidya tapu and one has to traverse throug dense forest to reach this point .the journey itself is very refreshing .The beach is situated alongside deep forest and unlike corbyns cove this beach is long wide with beutiful scenery on background.It is pretty clean and less crowded and sunset in this beach is mesmerizing . title: Wow!!
review_text: The dtive to Chidiya tapu in itself is so scenic - with some sea shores and jungles thrown in..... the last point is really pretty - with a small beach with mild waves, jungle and a cut little setting. I spent hours there just collecting shells, photographing and relaxing. Best time to visit is wee hours of morning.

title: A beautiful beach in thick of greens
review_text: A beach secluded from population with access restricted and under control of Forest Department. Absolutely free of human pollution, I mean man induced nuisance, no plastic, no paper no cloth no coconut fruits, very few men. We were so much scared in going deeper and to far stretch of the beach as there was no body in sight. An extremely beautiful place. Said to be infested with salt water crocodiles.

title: Tapu with no Chidiya
review_text:
The name sounds misnomer. There are no Chidiya (Sparrows) to be seen here. You travel 30 Kms from Port Blair through dense forests on both sides and you will be suddenly greeted by sea shore. 

The sea is not noteworthy though. But you can enjoy an evening. You can walk the road through the forest just to enjoy the calm air. Beware of the buzzing vehicles with shrill horns they would blow at you.

title: beautiful for sunset and wading around
review_text: lovely beach about 40 min drive from port blair. very clean water. beach had some litter (but not major problem). a sign says beware of alligators...so not sure about swimming there. truly gorgeous sunset! gets dark fast thereafter, so best to be walking back to car before the sun is fully set.

title: Amazing Beauty
review_text:
Though the name sounded a bit weird, it was a pleasant pleasant surprise. Its a nice secluded beach in the midst of nature. 
Caution: this is a rocky beach (but beautiiifull)

title: good spot to watch a sunset and relax ......
review_text:
it is 25 kms from port blair can be easily reached by an auto . The auto person will take around 500 rs . last 5 kms the road is not so good , so not advisable to go by bike . 
the place is very calm , you can just sit and enjoy the amazing view . the beach is very clean and it is possible to enjoy playing in water. There are no stalls for food or snacks around . There is no entry to the beach after 5 pm . 
The fallen trees along the beach give good spot for taking some photos . 
Worth visiting.

title: Chidiyatapu - A serene sea shore
review_text:
The place is beautiful and serene. The drift wood resulted due to fall of Trees due to Tsunami look marvellous. However, u should visit the place by 4'O clock in the evening during October since by 5 pm, it starts getting dark and there is nothing you can enjoy in the dark. 
It is recommended to carry water and snacks since you will not find any shops or human life nearby except visitors. 

There is nothing much to do in the waters. It is stated that salt water crocodiles exist there. 
So be careful about that. 

If you are a person who doesn't enjoy driving one hour from Port Blair just for a half hour walk at the serene sea shore, you may as well skip visiting the place. Since Port Blair, Chidiya Tapu and Light & Sound Show at Cellular Jail can be covered in half a day from afternoon to evening, you may as well visit the place. More

review_text:

title: nice place
review_text: chidiya tapu takes about 40-45 min to reach. on the way you can enjoy good scenic beauty of lush green forest and ofcourse of the sea and its beaches. best time to visit is in the evening.it has great opportunities for photography specially of sunset. another beach called mundan pahar is few meters from here.go there for good photography and crystal clear water. few eateries are also available here.

title: BEST SUNSET POINT!!!!!
review_text: It is situated at the southern most tip of South Andaman Island. It is about 25 km from Port Blair in Andaman District. Dotted with green mangroves and peaceful forest, it is a perfect place for nature lovers.This village has earned the name, Bird Island.Chidiya Tapu Biological Park, Chidiya Tapu Beach, and the Sylvan Sands and Munda Pahar beaches are the prime attractions.Better to hire a car for the trip to chidiya tapu.You can see the sun go down behind a hillock from this beach(munda pahar beach).Its a worth to see sun going down over there.Beautiful sunset, can't explain its beauty.Better to go there in the afternoon means at second half as you can see the sunset over there.You can have bath over there.there are changing rooms and toliets for ladies and gents separately.But beware no networks will be available over there in your phone. title: Sea shore, setting sun and singing birds
review_text: An out of this world experience...lovely beach, a setting sun, chirping birds and abnormally tall trees.

title: Great Beach, Great Drive to the place
review_text: The drive to Chidiya Tapu from Port Blair is around 45 mins through roads bordering beaches and thick forests. Roads are good. Great Drive. Chidiya Tapu is ideally visited at around 4pm in the evening. It will enable you to watch the sunset which is amazing. Good place to take photos as there are some old uprooted trees on the beach. Beach is good, waters are reasonably calm. There is a Zoological park next to the beach which has crocodiles

title: Peaceful place and amazing sunset
review_text:
It is Around 25 – 28km from Port Blair city. This is famous for variety of birds but you cannot expect to see it from beach. You need to explore forest area. Forest is quite dense so it’s better to go inside with local guide or with local person. 
Beach is very beautiful and clam. Best beach to swim. 
Do not miss classic view of sunset and keep your camera ready to capture it. I am uploading some photos of beach and sunset. 
No food stalls nearby beach so carry some snacks.

title: Really nice place
review_text: You should go there. The landscape is nice. The sea gives you an illusion that it is a land-locked lake. The sunset from this spot is just gorgeous. The drift woods lying in the beach adds to the character of the beach.

title: Peaceful place and calm water
review_text:
Chidiya Tapu is 25 kms from Portblair city and its located at the southern most tip of South Andaman. 
Place is home to different varieties of birds but you have to go inside the forest to site these. It is an ideal place for a quite picnic. There are boards on the beach warning "Crocodile infested beach" but at the same time there are huts for women huts to change. The water is crystal clear and if if you are not scared then its one of the nicest place to swim and relax in water. 
If you enjoy collecting sea shells, then its ideal place for you. There are many varieties scattered all over the beach. 
Don't miss the sunset from Chidiya Tapu, it is breath-taking. I started at 1.00 PM from Portblair and reached in 40-45 minutes, departed after sunset. There is a forest guest, if one wanted to stay overnight. More
